etymology.description: 日(日) (rì, "sun") + 丁(丁) (dīng, "nail") = sun appearing over the horizon, 丁 indicates pronunciation
etymology.interpretation: Although the original interpretation is debated, the character combines 日(日) (rì, "sun") and 丁(丁) (dīng, "nail") to depict the sun rising. This is a visual representation of dawn, where the sun emerges at the horizon line.

examples.chinese: 破晓的旦光洒满山川(破曉的旦光灑滿山川)。
examples.pinyin: Pòxiǎo de dàn guāng sǎ mǎn shānchuān.
examples.english: The light of dawn scattered over the mountains and rivers.

examples.chinese: 黎明来临时(黎明來臨時)，旦光映红天边(旦光映紅天邊)。
examples.pinyin: Límíng láilín shí, dàn guāng yìng hóng tiānbiān.
examples.english: When dawn arrives, the light of dawn paints the sky red.

examples.chinese: 在寂静的山谷中(在寂靜的山谷中)，天边的旦光预告着新生(天邊的旦光預告著新生)。
examples.pinyin: Zài jìjìng de shāngǔ zhōng, tiānbiān de dàn guāng yùgào zhe xīnshēng.
examples.english: In the quiet valley, the light of dawn heralds new life.
